For both, observational and CMIP5 data, LAI is defined as the one-sided green leaf area per unit ground area in broadleaf canopies and as one-half the green needle surface area in needleleaf canopies. It is expressed in units of m 2 green leaf area per m 2 ground area. In this study, we use the annual maximum value of LAI, LAI max, to quantify the greenness level of a surface. LAI max is less influenced by cloudiness and noise; accordingly, it is most useful in investigations of long-term greening and browning trends.
